content.content: This in an informal poll (not a signal request). As ETH2 is scheduled to launch, I would expect we will see a variety of ETH composed tokens that have an association to some staking activity with the notion that “stakingETH” token (as an example) would be redeemable for when withdrawals are allowed. Do we want to want on-board these composed ETH tokens as collateral?     Yes No Abstain     0 voters     If yes, do we rely on the price of ETH or an oracle for staked ETH     ETH price oracle stakedETH price oracle     0 voters     If ETH oracle, do we apply a haircut for staking operations?     Yes No     0 voters     If yes, what haircut is appropriate?     0% 5% 10% 25% 50%     0 voters     Also, how large of a market cap should we require before onboarding given we need sufficient liquidity for keepers?     10-24MM 25-49MM 50-74MM 75-100MM 100MM+     0 voters     These polls will run for two weeks.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is conducting an informal poll to gather feedback on whether to onboard composed ETH tokens as collateral for ETH2 launch. The post includes several questions related to the use of an oracle for staked ETH, appropriate haircut for staking operations, and the required market cap for onboarding. The author is asking for feedback from the community through the polls, which will run for two weeks.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: I think it’s a great idea that can contribute to MKR value and DAI peg stability, because for some time there will not be anything else you can do with ETH2. However, you can´t go back from ETH2 to ETH1 so until ETH2 reaches phase 2 (possibly earlier) its value may be lower than ETH1.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
